page.title: 06FARMING IN BUNGAY
page.content: Historically Bungay was a sheep farming area,but now cereal farming is most common with barley and wheat as the main crops.Mettingham Castle Farm suppors heifers,chickens,geese,sheep and cereals on 250 acres.Barley and wheat are the main crops but potatoes are also grown. Manor Farm's fields are mostly 30 acres.On one side is Shoedevil Lane dating back to the Middle Ages.Rare shell ducks are breeding on their pond. The main crops are barley,bearded wheat,duram wheat and maize. The Uttings own two farms of 420 acres.There are 2 milking parlours for 128 cows.Maize and grass for silage are grown,also sugarbeet. Fenn Farm is a dairy farm of 300 acres,predominatly marshland.It supports a herd of 400 heifers and bullocks;grass and maize are grown.
